name: Easy Mexican Chicken Spaghetti
author: KLSTEVE
summary: This dish is an easy meal that my Mom used to make when we were little. It is so easy and it is delicious!
ingredients: 3  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces, or more to taste
1 (10.75 ounce) can  cream of mushroom soup
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
½ cup shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat olive oil in an oven-proof skillet over medium heat; cook and stir garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add onion; cook and stir until onion begins to soften, about 2 minutes
Add chicken; cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes
Mix cream of mushroom soup and diced tomatoes with green chile peppers into chicken mixture
Mix spaghetti into chicken mixture and top with Colby-Monterey Jack cheese
Place the skillet in the preheated oven and bake until cheese is melted and slightly brown, 15 to 20 minutes
